question_text: Which of the following best describes the difference between ephemeral and well-known ports?
answer_options: Ephemeral ports are used by servers; well-known ports are used by clients
Well-known ports are dynamically assigned; ephemeral ports are reserved by IANA
Well-known ports are assigned to common services; ephemeral ports are temporarily assigned to clients
Ephemeral ports are used for HTTP and HTTPS
correct_answer: Well-known ports are assigned to common services; ephemeral ports are temporarily assigned to clients
explanation: Well-known ports (0â€“1023) are reserved for specific services like HTTP (80) or DNS (53). Ephemeral ports are randomly chosen by clients during communication sessions.
